title: beta version won't launch correctly

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
So i updated to the beta, which was a bad call on my part. I installed it and ran and nothing came up on screen. thinking that it may have crashed i tried to start the log in client again and it showed me this blue box with a message that said it was already running. I have tried to kill it with the task manager and start again but the same error persists. I also ran the hextech repair tool to fix any strange settings like i saw in previous posts.

running on windows 7

replies.body:
I don't believe that the HRT will correct work for the updated client.  This black screen could be due to a connection issue, failing to establish a connection to our servers and check for updates and download assets.  To be sure, go over the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure your settings are aligned with the client.

You can return to the legacy client at anytime as well.  Go to the login screen and select launch legacy client under the Sign In button.  You can also launch it manually by selecting lol.launcher via your League of Legends folder.
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Hope that helps!

Hey, so I had the identical problem however having followed your advice, in addition to attempting to launch the client via the "lol.launcher" I had the issue persist, any other advice? 
Fyi in my instance if I try to launch the client, I don't even get to the pre-login launcher. It simply goes  to that black screen and suggests that "Another instance of the League client is running. Please close it and try again",

Just to confirm, you are receiving a black screen in both the updated and legacy clients?  If the legacy client's patcher is appearing as a black screen, then I'm learning even close towards there being a connection issue in this case.  Let me know, and any screenshots can help a lot too!

Black screen issue on New beta client issue persists for me since alpha. 

managed to fix it by launching beta client with --no-sandbox parameter

I want to thank you for this fix. This actually fixed my problem.

People will need to create a new shortcut on their desktop as the patch does not create a working shortcut on the desktop. Create the shortcut using the LeagueClient application located in the League folder in Program Files. Once the shortcut is created on the desktop, add the -no-sandbox parameter at the end of the location description.

Get it together rito...

THIS.   Adding the "-no-sandbox" to the Target Location in the shortcut for the new LeagueClient.exe executable got it to work.   All this other stupid advice about my internet connection (lulz), Hextech Repair, blah blah.    The client is clearly just busted, and not sure what this "-no-sandbox" does, but it actually stopped the beta client from doing NOTHING.

Thanks broseph.
Hey my man, I'm a little technically inept. How and what exactly do I do in order to add the "-no-sandbox" to said target location?

Find the shortcut that opens up the client, right click and select properties. Somewhere there will be a location. you put it right after that with a space inbetween. Had the same problem, this fixed it. It should look like this :   "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\LeagueClient.exe" -no-sandbox

This fixed the issue,
Really appreciate all the help you've offered and the little "how to"
Thanks again.

Hope this fix can be relayed back to the team for it proves effective.

Interesting!  Will look into this and pass it on.  I'm not part of the client update team, so any issues you guys are seeing are problems that we are finding and troubleshooting together.  In general, I'll try and go forward with most common troubleshooting techniques to help rule out possibilities.  These blah blahs are critical towards finding solutions!  Keep in mind this is an open beta so not everything may work, and players may return to the legacy client during this testing period if they don't wish to participate.

Having same problem as Captain, I can't open the old client or the new one, without getting the message "Another instance of the League client is running. Please close it and try again" Even though i opened task manager and closed it, i still keep getting that same message, i also tried the other things you said to do, including creating a shortcut of the old client and using HRT.

Hello, i am having the same problem suddenly with the new beta. i downloaded it and go to click launch button and nothing happens. In task manager LoL shows up on processes but not on applications. i can end process and try again endlessly but it never works. if i dont end process and try to open LoL again it gives that black window and the message saying it is already running. so in processes in task manager its recognized as running but in applications its not and nowhere on my computer does the login screen pop up so i can attempt to log in or revert to pre beta version. Im using windows vista and i seen another post on the internet where a person had my same issue and they said they had windows 7. Riot needs to come up with some real solutions and advice quickly PLEASE. If i open from C drive riot games league of legends it doesnt help. through shortcut icon or direct file it opens the Launch screen and then does not work when launch is clicked. it does seem like something happens for a second after i hit launch. like it did something but didnt work properly and LeagueClient.exe*32 and LeagueClientUx.exe*32 opens up in the processes in task manager but not in applications. kind of repeating myself. but i really want to be understood and offered a legitimate solution. Hoping for a reply sooner then later. i also have a ticket made that i hope is looked at soon. thank you for your hard work riot, i really hope you can resolve my issue swiftly. the -no-sandbox thing didnt work for me. nothing has. can anyone please give me guidance.
